instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
I get stock on this point:
The machine works perfectly without Power Audio Board Cable (821-1722).
When i connect the cable, i notice the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> go down for 1.2V and without the cable i get 3.4v
The back light work for one second when the power audio cable is plugged.
Already replaced DC power Jack I/O and the power audio cable for make sure thats is not the problem.

Can u guys help me figure out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message: What about the connector motherboard side??? Corrosion around it???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message: Pull up resistor on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is bad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message: Nothing. Thats why i cant figure out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Still the same. 
Without the cable, works. If i connect, the back light doesn't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
I just got a second (flash) back light and then black.
Any idea guys?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
It's normal. when <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is not 3.42v and around 1.2v backlight will come as soon as you plug power near the chime instant and then black.
worse case is SMC.
With cable connector plugged, compare <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> diode mode reading with good board.
did you checked voltage on both side of pullup resistor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
I don't have a good board for test, but i have measurement in both sides:

pullup resistor:
<RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR> - Pin 1 - <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 0V
Pin 2 - <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42V

Diodo mode
My board With Audio Cable and IO connected:
Pin 1  - 0.405 - without Audio Cable - 0.600
pin 2 - 0.282 -  without audio cable - 0.282

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
Duke, I pulled the resistor.
After i pulled the resistor, with ou without the cable audio i don;t get backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message: Measure value of <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>. What is resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> with and without flat cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
Already have this measurement :
<RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR> is 99K on the schematics is 100K.
I will check R to G when i back to the office.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message:
Short to ground on <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR> with Audio Cable:
Pin 1 - <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 115.3 k 立
Pin 2 - <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 054.6 k 立

without cable:
Pin 1 = 187 k 立
pin 2 = 054.6 k 立

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - smc lid
threads.message: Seems like a bad IO board and cable to me. Compare values with a known good board, 3437 or 00165 should be the same.
